CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 11, 1954, pg. 11 reads: "Annual Tea Party - The Bellona Club gave its nineteenth annual tea party for the mothers in Lemington Home for the Aged and Infirm, Sunday, Dec. 5. The program officially opened the Christmas season for the home.  Mrs. Ina Wayne was emcee.  Mrs. Lucy Robinson spoke and Mrs. Waite and Mrs. M. Woodling gave readings.  Guests came from Cleveland and Belle Vernon for the affair.  Pictured are members and guests. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of members and guests of the Bellona Club, including woman seated at table wearing eyeglasses and polka dot dress, gathered for nineteenth annual tea party at the Lemington Home
